Question
========

A and B are two events in a chance experiment. The following probabilities are given: P(A) = 0.30, P(B) = 0.40, P(A or B) = 0.58. Which of the following statements is correct?

Answerlist
----------

* A and B are independent.
* A and B are dependent (i.e., not independent).
* Based on the given probabilities, it cannot be concluded with certainty whether A and B are independent or not.

Solution
========

Answerlist
----------

* A and B are independent..: Correct
* A and B are dependent (i.e.: not independent)...: Incorrect
* Based on the given probabilities, it cannot be concluded with certainty whether A and B are independent or not...: Incorrect
